passage_text: In-Text Citation: Use an in-text citation in situations where you are not quoting someone directly, but rather using information from another source such as a fact, summary, or paraphrase to support your own ideas.

In-text Citations. You CANNOT use information from any website or published book unless you give the author (or site) credit--BOTH inside your text and at the end of your paper. In other words, it is NOT enough to simply list the sources you used on a Works Cited Page or References List.

Work has three authors. If a work has three authors, format their names and the page reference as follows or use the names in a signal phrase. Examples: Globalization is an inevitable process.

You can give credit to your sources within your text in two different ways: by using a signal phrase or by simply using an in-text citation. Signal phrase: a signal phrase lets the reader know, right at the beginning of the sentence, that the information he or she is about to read comes from another source.
